items.title: performance hit with svgstring()
items.body:
I decide to test for speed differences between `svglite` and `svgstring`.  I was surprised that `svglite` actually is significantly quicker on my machine.


```
> system.time({
+   fl <- tempfile(fileext=".svg")
+   svglite( file = fl )
+   plot(runif(10000),1:10000)
+   dev.off()
+ })
   user  system elapsed 
   0.13    0.06    0.20 
> 
> unlink(fl)
> 
> system.time({
+   svgstring()
+   plot(runif(10000),1:10000)
+   dev.off()
+ })
   user  system elapsed 
  75.99    2.25   79.60 
```


I'm wondering now if we should revert `inlineSVG` back to `svglite`.

Changing to `runif(1000)` and using `microbenchmark`, I get the following.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/837910/12932361/0e0f5156-cf48-11e5-8d35-ca32ef33daf1.png)


```
library(microbenchmark)
library(svglite)

svg_lite_fun <- function(){
  fl <- tempfile(fileext=".svg")
  svglite( file = fl )
  plot(runif(1000),1:1000)
  dev.off()
  unlink(fl)
}

svg_string_fun <- function(){
  svgstring()
  plot(runif(1000),1:1000)
  dev.off()
}

mb <- microbenchmark( svg_lite_fun(), svg_string_fun(), times = 10)
boxplot(mb)
```

items.title: fix editSVG to work with new inlineSVG/svgstring
items.body:
In a370b059df141a7cec9a8ae2a58e9677c1687c6c, [`inlineSVG`](https://github.com/hadley/svglite/blob/a370b059df141a7cec9a8ae2a58e9677c1687c6c/R/inlineSVG.R#L61) we changed to use `svgstring` instead of `svglite`.  However, the `path` argument still exists even though it is no longer used.

Also, `editSVG` will no longer work since it requires a saved file.  Add the expected-to-be-removed-from-`inlineSVG` `path` argument to `editSVG`.

items.title: love the idea
items.body: sorry to use issues to cheer you on, but this is a fantastic idea, especially once other Leaflet plugins can be integrated.  Thanks so much for this.  I'll follow along closely.

items.title: add d3-lasso-plugin
items.body:
As an experiment in this [forked branch](https://github.com/timelyportfolio/scatterD3/tree/feature/lasso), I started to add some support for [D3-Lasso-Plugin](https://github.com/skokenes/D3-Lasso-Plugin) to `scatterD3` through an additional argument `lasso`.  Before I added additional features such as `Shiny`/`crosstalk`, I wanted to see how you felt about this new "feature".  Note, the major issue is it interferes with the zoom/drag chart and drag label functionality.  I know `plotly` and `bokeh` add a toolbar for this reason, but I would assume that is out of the scope for this focused library.

Here is a live [example](http://bl.ocks.org/timelyportfolio/c28bff74fbb9c59ec873).

![scatterd3-lasso](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/837910/12364483/6874f5a0-bb94-11e5-8796-0a4dbd9845e9.gif)

items.title: consider/add another xml viewer
items.body: I also found this https://github.com/juliangruber/xml-viewer.  Looks very nice with collapsiblity. Would you consider multiple viewers?  I know the idea was to keep it simple so understand if you want to limit to one.

items.title: link to listviewer issue requesting this functionality
items.body: So glad you decided to do this.  I thought I should link this issue in `listviewer` https://github.com/timelyportfolio/listviewer/issues/2 which requests related functionality.

items.title: custom sort
items.body: I think there is a way to custom sort for instance for dates or discrete numeric, but I cannot find the magic combination.  Are there any examples/demos that I am missing?  Thanks.

items.title: layers and multiple series
items.body: To follow through on conversation with @bowerth and @bart6114 https://github.com/Bart6114/dimple/issues/1, open this issue to tackle one of the biggest missing features of `rcdimple` which is layers or multiple series.  There is already some code in place to make this happen, but the integration is poor.  I'll work up a quick prototype to start the conversation.
